title: 2 Quick Ways to Backup WhatsApp Messages and Data

steps.title: Enable your iCloud Drive.
steps.content: Enable your iCloud Drive. You'll need to have access to iCloud Drive in order to back up your WhatsApp chats. To do so: Tap your Settings app to open Settings. Tap the "iCloud" tab. Tap the "iCloud Drive" tab. Swipe the iCloud Drive slider right; it should turn green.

steps.title: Exit your Settings app.
steps.content: Exit your Settings app. You can tap the Home button to do so.

steps.title: Tap your "WhatsApp" app to open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Tap your "WhatsApp" app to open WhatsApp. You can back up your phone's WhatsApp data directly from within WhatsApp's settings menu.

steps.title: Open the "Settings" menu.
steps.content: Open the "Settings" menu. This is in the bottom right corner of the WhatsApp screen.

steps.title: Tap the "Chats" option.
steps.content: Tap the "Chats" option. This will open your chat settings.

steps.title: Tap the "Chat Backup" option.
steps.content: Tap the "Chat Backup" option. This will take you to WhatsApp's chat backup page.

steps.title: Tap "Back Up Now".
steps.content: Tap "Back Up Now". This will initiate your backup. You also have a couple of other options in this menu: [1] X Research source "Auto Backup" - Choose whether automatic backups occur daily, weekly, monthly, or never. "Include Videos" - Include your chats' videos in the backup. If this is your first time backing up your data, your backup might take several minutes to complete.

steps.title: Wait for your backup to complete.
steps.content: Wait for your backup to complete. When WhatsApp is done backing up, you will see a "Last Backup: Today" note at the top of your Chat Backup page.

steps.title: Tap your "WhatsApp" app to open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Tap your "WhatsApp" app to open WhatsApp. You can back up WhatsApp from within its Settings menu. To back up WhatsApp, your Android must be synchronized with Google Drive.

steps.title: Tap your Android's menu button.
steps.content: Tap your Android's menu button. This should resemble three vertical dots. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the "Settings" option.
steps.content: Tap the "Settings" option. This should be in the lower right corner of your WhatsApp screen.

steps.title: Tap the "Chats" tab.
steps.content: Tap the "Chats" tab. This will open your Chats preferences.

steps.title: Tap "Chat backup".
steps.content: Tap "Chat backup". From here, you have a few options: "Back up to Google Drive" - Back up your chats to Google Drive. "Auto Backup" - Toggle auto-backup settings. You can choose "Daily", "Weekly", "Monthly", or "Off" (the default). "Include Videos" - Swipe this option to "On" to include videos in your backup settings.

steps.title: Tap "Back up to Google Drive".
steps.content: Tap "Back up to Google Drive". This will prompt you to choose a backup frequency.

steps.title: Tap "Back Up" to backup your chats immediately.
steps.content: Tap "Back Up" to backup your chats immediately. As long as your phone and your Google Drive account both have enough space for the backup, this process will continue.

steps.title: Choose an account on which to save your backup.
steps.content: Choose an account on which to save your backup. If you don't have a Google account registered, you will need to tap "Add Account" and enter your email address/password. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a network to use for your backup.
steps.content: Choose a network to use for your backup. You can do this by tapping "Back up over", then tapping a network. If you use data rather than wifi, you may get charged for the use.

steps.title: Wait for your backup to finish.
steps.content: Wait for your backup to finish. If this is your first backup, it may take a few minutes.
